<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=4>P</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>ROXY</FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=4>N</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>OTICE</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=4> </FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>OF</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=4> A</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>NNUAL</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=4> M</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>EETING</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=4> </FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>OF</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=4> S</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>HAREHOLDERS</FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=4>P</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>ROXY</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=4> S</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>TATEMENT</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE=2>


<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>F</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>ELLOW</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> S</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>HAREHOLDERS</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>:</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>How does
a company stay </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>129 years young</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>?</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Since its founding in 1883, Kroger
has grown from a single grocery store in Cincinnati, Ohio to America&#146;s largest
traditional grocery retailer. If there is one truth in our business, it is that
in order to stay &#147;young&#148; &#150; to stay </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>relevant</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; we need to keep changing
and improving.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Kroger stays fresh and relevant for
our Customers and delivers value for our Shareholders by </FONT><B><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Listening to Our Customers, Engaging with our Associates
</FONT></I></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>and being a </FONT><B><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Leader in Retail Innovation</FONT></I></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Kroger is listening, engaging and
innovating in more dynamic and sophisticated ways than ever before &#150; and our
Shareholders are benefiting as a result.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>* * *</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>2011 Highlights</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Kroger&#146;s strong financial
performance in 2011 returned significant capital to Shareholders and enabled us
to invest for future growth. Our Company&#146;s results are driven by our unique
formula for success: continue to reduce the overall cost of running our business
and use those savings to fund investments that strengthen our connection with
Customers. Greater Customer loyalty produces additional identical store sales
growth, which generates substantial free cash flow that we use to reward
Shareholders. This success formula enabled us to deliver </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>a</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>total return to Shareholders of 16.3 percent in 2011
</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>compared with 5.3 percent for the S&amp;P
500.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Fiscal 2011 sales grew $8.4 billion
for </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>total revenue of $90.4 billion&#151;a 10
percent growth</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> over the prior year. Net
earnings were $602.1 million, or $1.01 per diluted share. Excluding the effect
of the UFCW pension plan consolidation, earnings for the year were $1.2 billion,
or $2.00 per diluted share &#150; a </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>14 percent
increase over 2010 earnings per diluted share</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. This compares with 2010 sales of $82.0 billion and reported net
earnings of $1.1 billion, or $1.76 per diluted share. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Kroger&#146;s strong cash flow during the
year enabled us to </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>increase our quarterly
dividend by almost 10 percent</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> and repurchase
a record 67 million shares.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Our team successfully delivered on
several key commitments in 2011:</FONT></P>
<UL style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Effectively used free cash flow to reward
  Shareholders.</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Continued to win Customer loyalty.</FONT>
  <BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Grew market share.</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Increased identical supermarket sales for an
  industry-leading thirty-three consecutive quarters.</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Balanced cost reductions with investments in our
  Customer 1<SUP>st </SUP>strategy.</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Increased FIFO operating margin, excluding fuel,
  for the year.</FONT> </LI></UL>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>We achieved all of this in an
environment marked by rapid cost inflation and weak consumer confidence that
affected shopping behavior throughout the year. Our outstanding Associates made
a big difference through their knowledge, feedback and engagement in serving
every Customer. They deserve special thanks for a job well done, and I encourage
you to do that when you have an opportunity, whether at our annual meeting in
June or on your next visit to one of our stores.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>* * *</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Listening to Our
Customers</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>More than a century in business has
taught us that being a successful retailer begins with listening to the
Customer. Kroger employs sophisticated layers of listening through our unique
partnership with dunnhumbyUSA. This world-class firm specializes in mining
complex data &#150; such as the aggregation of data from our widely-used shopper
loyalty card &#150; for strategic insights that we use to make marketing and
promotional decisions. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>These unique Customer insights help
us reward our most loyal Customers with highly-relevant, personalized offers for
the products they like and buy regularly. </FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">1</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>This
unparalleled level of personalization is a key competitive advantage for Kroger.
In 2011 it helped us increase both the number of loyal households and total
households that shop with us, and was a major contributing factor to Kroger&#146;s
continued growth in market share. At year-end </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>we held the #1 or #2 share in 38 of our 42 major markets</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, and our share grew again in the markets where Wal-Mart
supercenters are a primary competitor. This is consistent with the trend we have
seen over the past several years. From </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>2007 to
2011, Kroger&#146;s market share increased from 19.1 percent to 21.1
percent</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, according to Nielsen Homescan
data.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Today, </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>nearly one-half of all U.S. households own a Kroger loyalty
card</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. This sustained focus on strengthening
our relationship with existing Customers continues to increase sales and
earnings that reward Shareholders.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Engaging with our
Associates</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>One of the four keys of our Customer
1<SUP>st</SUP> strategy is &#147;Our People are Great&#148;; and engaging, rewarding and
retaining our great people helps bring the other three keys &#150; our products,
prices and shopping experience &#150; to life. As partners in our success, we ask
Associates for their regular feedback on our Company&#146;s strengths and
opportunities. We listen, learn, and act on that feedback. One of the ways we do
this is through an active network of Associate-led Cultural Councils that
discuss issues at all levels of the organization. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Engaging our Associates also
delivers tremendous business value, helping us create new products, improve work
processes and reduce operating costs. Kroger is also launching internal business
social networking to connect Associates across geographic and functional
boundaries in ways not possible before.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Those who hold leadership roles in
our Company share two important characteristics: a passion for people and a
passion for results. Passion for people is defined by our Leadership Model,
which clearly outlines desired, positive leadership behaviors, and Kroger&#146;s core
Values. Our stronger emphasis on talent development today will fuel our business
success for years to come. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>All of these initiatives move us
ever closer to our goal of working together as one strong team and, ultimately,
to better serve our Customers.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Leader in Retail
Innovation</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Retail innovation at Kroger starts
and ends with the Customer. Here are some examples of how we are leading in
</FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>product, price </FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>and </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>shopping experience
</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>innovations.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><EM><U>Our
Products</U></EM></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. Product innovation helped all
three tiers of Corporate Brand offerings continue to achieve strong sales growth
in 2011: Private Selection, our premium, billion-dollar brand; Banner Brands,
our high-quality and affordable family-favorite product brand; and Value brand
items, aimed at our most price-sensitive Customers. Kroger&#146;s 39 manufacturing
plants supplied about 40 percent of the Corporate Brand units sold. These
Corporate Brand products accounted for more than one-quarter of Kroger&#146;s total
grocery department sales dollars, and more than one-third of total grocery unit
sales, in 2011.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Our fastest-growing store department
is Natural Foods, and our Customers tell us they want organic and natural
products that are easily identified and affordable. In response we are
initiating the largest product launch in Kroger&#146;s history &#150; our natural and
organic product brand, </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Simple
Truth</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. In stores today you&#146;ll find Simple
Truth Organic milk and eggs, and we will expand the Simple Truth brand in other
categories throughout this year and 2013. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><EM><U>Our
Prices</U></EM></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. A key feature of our Customer
1<SUP>st</SUP> strategy is price investment. </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We are currently saving shoppers $2.2 billion annually through our
everyday low prices</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. These investments are
possible because of Kroger&#146;s innovative cycle of value creation. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Innovation also means embracing new
technologies. Customers are increasingly using the Internet and mobile phone
applications as their source for coupons. We pioneered aggregating coupons from
multiple providers and putting them on one site. Today we offer one of the
world&#146;s largest selections of digital coupons available at Kroger.com.
</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>When it comes to Kroger, Customers
also told us they wanted &#147;an app for that&#148;. We developed the Kroger Mobile App,
which offers digital coupons, a cloud-based shopping list and real-time display
of accumulated fuel rewards, adding convenience and enhancing our connection
with loyal shoppers. In just a little over a year, </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger&#146;s app has been downloaded to more than 1 million phones
</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>and continues to grow.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">2</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><I><U>Shopping Experience</U></I></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. Perhaps no
other area is as exciting or ripe for innovation as the shopping experience in
our stores. We continue to focus on aspects of the shopping experience that
Customers say are most important to improve. At the top of that list is speed of
checkout. No one likes waiting in long lines, so we set out to improve the
experience. We employed multiple ways to shorten checkout time, including
technology that helps us staff our registers when the Customer is ready to
checkout. As a result, </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>we have reduced the
average wait time from several minutes to less than one minute</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>* * *</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>These are just some of the ways
Kroger continues to progress&#151;to be more and more relevant to Customers, to be a
preferred retail employer and a leader in retail innovation. Even in the midst
of all this change, however, some things remain constant. These enduring values
include Kroger&#146;s commitment to </FONT><B><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>valuing our
Associates, partnering with the communities we serve </FONT></I></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>and </FONT><B><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>rewarding
Shareholders</FONT></I></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. The importance of these
things to our Company and our leadership will never change. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Valuing our
Associates</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>We are proud of our record as a job
creator. Kroger has created more than </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>29,000
new jobs</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> in the last five years, and today
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>employs more than 339,000
Associates</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. Our commitment to Associates
includes our dedication to safety, significant investments in training, solid
wages, and good quality, affordable health care. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Safety is one of our core values and
Kroger is one of the safest companies in our industry. Associate engagement in
safety programs has </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>reduced accident
rates</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> in our stores and manufacturing plants
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>by 75 percent since 1995</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Partnering with the Communities we
Serve</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Kroger was honored to be recognized
by </FONT><B><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Forbes</FONT></I></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> magazine as </FONT><B><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>the most generous
company in America </FONT></I></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>in 2011, based on
charitable giving measured as a percentage of pre-tax profits. I am very proud
of this remarkable distinction, and our Associates and Customers are,
too.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Like other areas of our business,
Kroger&#146;s charitable contributions are focused on those areas that Customers have
told us are important to them: feeding the hungry and supporting women&#146;s health,
the military and their families, and local organizations and schools. In 2011,
Kroger:</FONT></P>
<UL style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; text-align: justify"><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Donated the equivalent of </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>160 million meals </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>to
  local food banks through our partnership with Feeding</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>America.</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Partnered with vendors and Customers to
  give</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> more than $5.5 million in support of
  women&#146;s health</FONT></B> <B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>and breast cancer
  awareness programs</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Partnered with vendors and Customers to raise
  </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>$1.5 million for the USO</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Supported more than </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>30,000 schools </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>and local
  organizations through our Community Rewards Program</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>that delivers personalized, Customer-driven donations based on total
  purchases.</FONT> </LI></UL>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>When you combine the cash, food and
product we donate to a variety of causes and programs, </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger contributes more than $220 million </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>annually to support the communities we serve.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>We also support our communities
through our ongoing commitment to supplier diversity. Kroger currently spends
more than </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>$1 billion annually with women- and
minority-owned businesses</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. This is good for
the business and the community, as our engagement with these suppliers positions
Kroger to continue providing for an increasingly diverse Customer base.
</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>In recognition of our leadership,
Kroger was inducted into the </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>United States
Hispanic Chamber of Commerce</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>
</FONT><B><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Million Dollar Club </FONT></I></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>and named one of the &#147;Top 50 Organizations for Multicultural
Business Opportunities&#148; by DiversityBusiness.com during the year. Kroger also
remains a member of the </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Billion Dollar
Roundtable</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">3</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Finally,
Kroger continues to make significant strides as an environmentally-sustainable
retailer. Our sustainability efforts reduce Kroger&#146;s impact on the environment
</FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>and</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> reduce
business operating costs. I&#146;m pleased to report that Kroger has:</FONT></P>
<UL style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; text-align: justify"><LI><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Reduced energy consumption by 30 percent
  </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>since 2000. That&#146;s enough electricity to
  power every</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>single-family home in Fort Worth,
  Texas for one year.</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Reduced </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>landfill
  waste to zero at half of our 39 manufacturing facilities</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. Our manufacturing</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>plants
  reduced the amount of waste sent to landfill by 22 million pounds.</FONT>
<BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Improved fleet efficiency by 15.5 percent
  </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>since 2008. We continue to improve the
  efficiency of</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>transporting food to our stores
  by loading trucks to capacity, increasing miles per gallon and reducing</FONT>
  <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>how often we drive empty trailers.</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Saved nearly one billion bags </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>from being used through more efficient bagging techniques,
  educating</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Customers and making available a
  variety of reusable bags.</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;
  </LI><LI><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Progressed toward our sustainable seafood goals
  </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>in partnership with the World Wildlife
  Fund.</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>More information on this commitment and
  other initiatives is available at sustainability.kroger.com.</FONT> </LI></UL>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>A Record of Rewarding
Shareholders</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Kroger has a strong track record of
rewarding Shareholders. In fiscal 2011, </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger
returned more than $1.8 billion to shareholders</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> through share repurchases and cash dividends. Total payout to
Shareholders has averaged over 90 percent of Kroger&#146;s adjusted net income over
the past five years. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>In fiscal 2011 Kroger repurchased
$1.4 billion of our Common Shares. </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Since
January 2000, Kroger has returned $8.0 billion to Shareholders through share
repurchases</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. At the end of fiscal 2011,
approximately $475 million remained under the $1 billion share repurchase
program authorized by the board of directors in September of fiscal 2011.
</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>We also paid dividends of $257
million in fiscal 2011, increasing the dividends paid to Shareholders in
</FONT><B><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>each</FONT></I></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>
of the years since we resumed paying a dividend in 2006. Since 2006, Kroger has
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>paid more than $1.25 billion in dividends to
Shareholders</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. We have been able to accomplish
this while maintaining our investment-grade credit rating and improving our debt
leverage ratio and annual interest expense.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>We target &#150; and consistently deliver
&#150; annual earnings per share growth averaging 6 percent to 8 percent, plus a
dividend of 1.5 percent to 2 percent, for a total Shareholder return of
approximately 8 percent to 10 percent. We expect this total Shareholder return
to compare favorably to the S&amp;P 500 over each rolling three-to-five year
time horizon. For fiscal 2012, we expect annual earnings per share growth to
exceed our business model. </FONT></P>
<P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>* * *</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Optimism for the
Future</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Looking ahead, we expect the overall
retail environment to improve slightly in 2012. All of the data we are seeing
suggests the overall economy and Customer sentiment are improving. Both give us
reason to be optimistic about the year ahead. Of course, these times are not
without challenges. We will continue to carefully monitor the pace of economic
recovery, higher gas prices and the slowing of the rate of inflation. We remain
confident that our Customer 1<SUP>st</SUP> strategy continues to be the right
one&#151;and our outstanding results bear this out. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>While certain factors will influence
all retailers, we believe Kroger&#146;s success will continue to come from making
tactical adjustments as needed throughout the year, just as we did throughout
2011&#151;and staying true to our Customer 1<SUP>st</SUP> strategy, which leads us to
listen, engage and innovate in ever more powerful ways.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>On behalf of the entire Kroger team,
thank you for your continued trust and support. </FONT></P><IMG src="kroger_def14a1x6x1.jpg" border=0><BR>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>David B. Dillon<BR></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Chairman of the Board and<BR>Chief Executive
Officer</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">4</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>

Kroger Co. Community Service Award for 2011:</FONT></P>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>N</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>OTICE </FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>OF</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> A</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>NNUAL</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> M</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>EETING</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>
</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>OF</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>
S</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>HAREHOLDERS</FONT></B></P>
<P align=right><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Cincinnati, Ohio, May 11, 2012</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To All Shareholders of The Kroger
Co.:</FONT></P>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>The
annual meeting of shareholders of The Kroger Co. will be held at the MUSIC HALL
BALLROOM, MUSIC HALL, 1241 Elm Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202, on June 21, 2012,
at 11 a.m., eastern time, for the following purposes:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>1.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To elect the directors for the
      ensuing year;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>2.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To consider and act upon an
      advisory vote to approve executive compensation;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>3.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To consider and act upon a
      proposal to ratify the selection of independent public accountants for the
      year 2012;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>4.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To act upon two shareholder
      proposals, if properly presented at the annual meeting; and</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>5.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To transact such other business
      as may properly be brought before the meeting;</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>all as set forth in the Proxy Statement
accompanying this Notice. Holders of common shares of record at the close of
business on April 23, 2012, will be entitled to vote at the meeting.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>A</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>TTENDANCE</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>Only shareholders and persons
holding proxies from shareholders may attend the meeting. </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>If you are attending the meeting, please bring the notice of
the meeting that was separately mailed to you or the top portion of your proxy
card, either of which will serve as your admission ticket</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>YOUR MANAGEMENT DESIRES TO HAVE A
LARGE NUMBER OF SHAREHOLDERS REPRESENTED AT THE MEETING, IN PERSON OR BY PROXY.
PLEASE VOTE YOUR PROXY ELECTRONICALLY VIA THE INTERNET OR BY TELEPHONE. IF YOU
HAVE ELECTED TO RECEIVE PRINTED MATERIALS, YOU MAY SIGN AND DATE THE PROXY AND
MAIL IT IN THE SELF-ADDRESSED ENVELOPE PROVIDED. NO POSTAGE IS REQUIRED IF
MAILED WITHIN THE UNITED STATES.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>If you are unable to attend the
annual meeting, you may listen to a live webcast of the meeting, which will be
accessible through our website, www.thekrogerco.com, at 11 a.m., eastern
time.</FONT></P>
<DIV align=right>
<TABLE style="BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="10%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>By order of the Board of
      Directors,</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Paul W. Heldman,
  Secretary</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">6</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>P</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>ROXY</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> S</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>TATEMENT</FONT></B></P>
<P align=right><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Cincinnati, Ohio, May 11, 2012</FONT></P>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Your
proxy is solicited by the Board of Directors of The Kroger Co., and the cost of
solicitation will be borne by Kroger. We will reimburse banks, brokers,
nominees, and other fiduciaries for postage and reasonable expenses incurred by
them in forwarding the proxy material to their principals. Kroger has retained
D.F. King &amp; Co., Inc., 48 Wall Street, New York, New York, to assist in the
solicitation of proxies and will pay that firm a fee estimated at present not to
exceed $15,000. Proxies may be solicited personally, by telephone,
electronically via the Internet, or by mail.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>David B. Dillon, John T. LaMacchia,
and Bobby S. Shackouls, all of whom are Kroger directors, have been named
members of the Proxy Committee.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>The principal executive offices of
The Kroger Co. are located at 1014 Vine Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202-1100. Our
telephone number is 513-762-4000. This Proxy Statement and Annual Report, and
the accompanying proxy, were first furnished to shareholders on May 11,
2012.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>As of the close of business on April
23, 2012, our outstanding voting securities consisted of 560,971,811 common
shares, the holders of which will be entitled to one vote per share at the
annual meeting. The shares represented by each proxy will be voted unless the
proxy is revoked before it is exercised. Revocation may be in writing to
Kroger&#146;s Secretary, or in person at the meeting, or by appointment of a
subsequent proxy. Shareholders may not cumulate votes in the election of
directors.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>The effect of broker non-votes and
abstentions on matters presented for shareholder vote is as follows:</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><STRONG>Item No. 1, Election of
Directors</STRONG></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; An affirmative majority of
the total number of votes cast &#147;for&#148; or &#147;against&#148; a director nominee is required
for election. Accordingly, broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect
on this proposal.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><STRONG>Item No. 2, Advisory vote to
approve executive compensation</STRONG></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150;
Approval by shareholders of executive compensation requires the affirmative vote
of the majority of shares participating in the voting. Accordingly, broker
non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on this proposal.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><STRONG>Item No. 3, Selection of
Auditors</STRONG></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; Ratification by shareholders
of the selection of independent public accountants requires the affirmative vote
of the majority of shares participating in the voting. Accordingly, abstentions
will have no effect on this proposal.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><STRONG>Item No. 4 and Item No. 5,
Shareholder Proposals</STRONG></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; The affirmative
vote of a majority of shares participating in the voting on a shareholder
proposal is required for its adoption. Proxies will be voted AGAINST these
proposals unless the Proxy Committee is otherwise instructed on a proxy properly
executed and returned. Broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on
these proposals.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">7</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>P</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>ROPOSALS </FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>TO</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> S</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>HAREHOLDERS</FONT></B></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>E</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>LECTION</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> </FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>OF</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> D</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>IRECTORS<BR></FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>(I</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>TEM</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> N</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>O</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. 1)</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>The Board
of Directors, as now authorized, consists of fourteen members. All members are
to be elected at the annual meeting to serve until the annual meeting in 2013,
or until their successors have been elected by the shareholders or by the Board
of Directors pursuant to Kroger&#146;s Regulations, and qualified. Kroger&#146;s Articles
of Incorporation provide that the vote required for election of a director by
the shareholders, except in a contested election or when cumulative voting is in
effect, will be the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast for or
against the election of a nominee.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT>The experience, qualifications,
attributes, and skills that led the Corporate Governance Committee and the Board
to conclude that the following individuals should serve as directors are set
forth opposite each individual&#146;s name. The committee memberships stated below
are those in effect as of the date of this proxy statement. It is intended that,
except to the extent that authority is withheld, proxies will be voted for the
election of the following persons:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD noWrap style="text-align: center" width="20%"></TD>
    <TD noWrap style="text-align: center" width="74%" colSpan=5><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>Professional</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD noWrap style="text-align: center" width="1%"></TD>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center" noWrap width="20%"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>Name</FONT></B></TD>

      </FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>D</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>IRECTOR FOR <FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">T</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>ERMS OF <FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">O</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>FFICE</FONT></FONT></FONT></STRONG></TD>

    <TD noWrap style="text-align: center" width="3%"></TD></TR>
  <TR style="LINE-HEIGHT: normal">
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="20%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=left><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Reuben V.
    Anderson</FONT></B></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=center width="74%" bgColor=#c0c0c0 colSpan=5>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Anderson is a Senior Partner
      in the Jackson, Mississippi office of Phelps Dunbar, a regional law firm
      based in New Orleans. Prior to joining this law firm, he was a justice of
      the Supreme Court of Mississippi. Mr. Anderson is a director of AT&amp;T
      Inc., and during the past five years was a director of Trustmark
      Corporation. He is a member of the Corporate Governance and Public
      Responsibilities Committees.</FONT></P>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Anderson has extensive
      litigation experience, and he served as the first African-American Justice
      on the Mississippi Supreme Court. His knowledge and judgment gained
      through years of legal practice are of great value to the Board. In
      addition, as former Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Tougaloo College
      and a resident of Mississippi, he brings to the Board his insights into
      the African-American community and the southern region of the United
      States. Mr. Anderson has served on numerous board committees, including
      audit, public policy, finance, executive, and nominating
      committees.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>69</FONT></P></TD>

    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center" noWrap width="72%"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>Occupation (1)</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=left width="1%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center" noWrap width="1%"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>Age</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center" noWrap width="1%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="20%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Susan M.
      Phillips</FONT></B></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="72%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Dr. Phillips is Professor
      Emeritus of Finance at The George Washington University School of
      Business. She joined that university as a Professor and Dean in 1998. She
      retired as Dean of the School of Business as of June 30, 2010, and as
      Professor the following year. She was a member of the Board of Governors
      of the Federal Reserve System from December 1991 through June 1998. Before
      her Federal Reserve appointment, Dr. Phillips served as Vice President for
      Finance and University Services and Professor of Finance in The College of
      Business Administration at the University of Iowa from 1987 through 1991.
      She is a director of CBOE Holdings, Inc., State Farm Mutual Automobile
      Insurance Company, State Farm Life Insurance Company, State Farm Companies
      Foundation, National Futures Association, the Chicago Board Options
      Exchange, and Agnes Scott College. Dr. Phillips also was a trustee of the
      Financial Accounting Foundation until the end of 2010. She is a member of
      the Audit and Financial Policy Committees.</FONT></P>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Dr. Phillips brings to the Board
      strong financial acumen, along with a deep understanding of, and
      involvement with, the relationship between corporations and the
      government. Her experience in academia brings a unique and diverse
      viewpoint to the deliberations of the Board. Dr. Phillips has been
      designated an Audit Committee financial expert.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>

    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="72%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Rogel was elected Chairman of
      the Board of Weyerhaeuser Company, a forest products company, in 1999 and
      was President and Chief Executive Officer and a director thereof from
      December 1997 to January 1, 2008 when he relinquished the role of
      President. He relinquished the CEO role in April of 2008 and retired as
      Chairman as of April 2009. Before that time Mr. Rogel was Chief Executive
      Officer, President and a director of Willamette Industries, Inc. He served
      as Chief Operating Officer of Willamette Industries, Inc. until October
      1995 and, before that time, as an executive and group vice president for
      more than five years. Mr. Rogel is a director of Union Pacific Corporation
      and a director and non-executive Chairman of the Board of
      Energy</FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Solutions</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, Inc. He is a member of the Corporate Governance and
      Financial Policy Committees.</FONT></P>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Rogel has extensive
      experience in management of large corporations at all levels. He brings to
      the Board a unique perspective, having led a national supplier of paper
      products prior to his retirement. Mr. Rogel previously served as Kroger&#146;s
      Lead Director, and has served on compensation, finance, audit, and
      governance committees of other corporations.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>

      retail experience, first with Kroger and then with increasing levels of
      responsibility and leadership at Staples, Inc. His efforts helped carve
      out a new market niche for the international retailer that he leads. His
      understanding of retail operations and consumer insights are of particular
      value to the Board. Mr. Sargent has been designated an Audit Committee
      financial expert.</FONT></P></TD>

      company since 1995 and President and Chief Executive Officer of Burlington
      Resources Oil and Gas Company (formerly known as Meridian Oil Inc.), a
      wholly-owned subsidiary of Burlington Resources, since 1994. Mr. Shackouls

      Storage, L.P. and Oasis Petroleum Inc. During the past five years, Mr.
      Shackouls was a director of ConocoPhillips. He has been appointed by
      Kroger&#146;s Board to serve as Lead Director. Mr. Shackouls is chair of the

      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Shackouls brings to the Board
      the critical thinking that comes with a chemical engineering background.
      His guidance of a major natural resources company, coupled with his
      corporate governance expertise, forms the foundation of his leadership
      role on Kroger&#146;s Board.</FONT></P></TD>
